main_definition: A hit or strike using a projectile weapon, also an opportunity to succeed at something, or the act of taking photographs.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An attempt made by firing a gun or other projectile weapon with the intent to hit a target
meanings_and_examples.example: He took careful aim and fired his shot at the target.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A chance or opportunity for success in an endeavor, especially when it is fleeting
meanings_and_examples.example: Getting this job offer was my last shot before I had to look elsewhere.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act of taking photographs with a camera
meanings_and_examples.example: She fired off several shots trying to capture the perfect picture of the sunset.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A small quantity or amount of something, often used in reference to alcoholic beverages
meanings_and_examples.example: He ordered another shot of whiskey at the bar.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An offer or proposal for a business deal, typically involving financial transactions
meanings_and_examples.example: They extended an attractive shot on investment to their potential partners.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A sudden and unexpected opportunity that may not come again
meanings_and_examples.example: The chance to speak at the conference was a golden shot for her career.
